Package ohos.backgroundtaskmgr

Class BackgroundTaskManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.backgroundtaskmgr.BackgroundTaskManager

  • public class BackgroundTaskManager
extends Object
    Manages background tasks.

    After an application runs in the background for a period of time, it will enter the suspended state and cannot execute tasks. If the application needs to continue unfinished tasks in the background, it can send a request to BackgroundTaskManager to delay transition to the suspended state. This class provides the methods to request and cancel delayed transition to the suspended state and to query the remaining time before an application enters the suspended state.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.ResourceSchedule#BACKGROUND_TASK_MANAGER

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BackgroundTaskManager​(Context context)
      A constructor used to create a BackgroundTaskManager instance for initializing background task management objects based on the specified application context.

    • Method Detail

      • requestSuspendDelay

        public DelaySuspendInfo requestSuspendDelay​(String reason,
                                            ExpiredCallback cb)
                                     throws RemoteException
        Requests delayed transition to the suspended state.

        If an application needs to execute tasks in the background, it must send a request for delayed transition to the suspended state and describe the reason. When the requested delay duration times out, ExpiredCallback will be called to notify the application.

        Parameters:
        reason - Indicates the reason for delayed transition to the suspended state. The parameter cannot be null.
        cb - Indicates the callback for timeout of the delay duration. The parameter cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns DelaySuspendInfo carrying the result of requesting delayed transition to the suspended state.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception when a remote communication error occurs. In this case, you are advised to call this method again.
        Since:
        1

      • cancelSuspendDelay

        public void cancelSuspendDelay​(int requestId)
                        throws RemoteException
        Cancels delayed transition to the suspended state.

        If an application finishes a task before the delay duration times out, the application can request to terminate the delayed transition to the suspended state.

        Parameters:
        requestId - Uniquely identifies the request for delayed transition to the suspended state. You can call DelaySuspendInfo#getRequestId() to obtain requestId. Note that an application can query only requestId of the requests it initiated.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception when a remote communication error occurs. In this case, you are advised to call this method again.
        Since:
        1

      • getRemainingDelayTime

        public int getRemainingDelayTime​(int requestId)
                          throws RemoteException
        Obtains the remaining time before an application enters the suspended state.
        Parameters:
        requestId - Uniquely identifies the request for delayed transition to the suspended state. You can call DelaySuspendInfo#getRequestId() to obtain requestId. Note that an application can query only requestId of the requests it initiated.
        Returns:
        Returns the remaining time before an application enters the suspended state, in ms.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception when a remote communication error occurs. In this case, you are advised to call this method again.
        Since:
        1
